page.title: 11LOCAL HISTORY GOLDSBRO'AREA
page.content: Goldsborough has been an estate village since before 1086} with just three families owning the estate up to 1952. The family of{de Goldesburgh}owned the manor for at least 400 years and were succeeded by the{Huttons }and the {Byerleys}by marriage. The estate was purchased by{Daniel Lascelles}in 1760} and was the home of{Lord Harewood}and Mary the{Princess Royal}in the 1920's. Goldsborough hall was built in 1625 by{Sir Richard Hutton.}The previous hall, destroyed in a family feud was sited down{Midgeley Lane,}the Goldsbro family later went to the colony of New England,{U.S.A.}.The church is famous for its 9th ct fountstone,crusader tombs.A hoard of{Viking coins/jewelry was discovered in 1859,some are in the {British Museum},others were made into} an almsdish,still used today.
